subject: Nutrition
title: The Glycemic Index Explained
description: A quick, practical guide to The Glycemic Index Explained.

hook.text: White bread spikes your blood sugar faster than table sugar. The glycemic index explains why.

buildup.text: The glycemic index ranks carbs by how quickly they raise blood glucose on a scale of 0 to 100.

discovery.text: High-GI foods like white rice spike glucose rapidly. Low-GI foods like lentils release it slowly.

twist.text: GI changes based on cooking, ripeness, and what you eat alongside. A baked potato's GI drops with butter.

climax.text: Glycemic loadâ€”which factors in portion sizeâ€”is more useful than glycemic index alone.

punchline.text: How fast sugar hits your blood depends on context.

quiz.question: What does the glycemic index measure?
options: How quickly a carb raises blood glucose
